notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Several leaves more or less damaged.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A daily prayer book according to the Ashkenazi rite, with a number of poetical pieces.

msItem.title: Special portions for Rosh ḥodesh, Purim, etc.
Prayers for Rosh ha-Shanah and Yom Kipur

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Catchwords at the end of the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script, punctuated, of the 14th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Siddur, German Use. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,086.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 192: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [266v].
